website_summaries.verdict: Versatile, sturdy, and built with high-quality optics, the Sigma APO 70-200mm F2.8 EX DG OS HSM offers a good value, although it's not exactly cheap.
pros: The Sigma APO 70-200mm F2.8 EX DG OS HSM has the fast f2.8 aperture of in-house competitors, but not their high price
It delivers effective image stabilization, as well as solid sharpness, bokeh, and durability
cons: It lacks weather sealing, and the autofocus falls a step short

customer_reviews.title: 100% happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this lens for about 5 years and it’s been my go to. Forcing is quick, image quality is great. The Nikon 70-200 lenses are sharper, however not in a meaningful way. This lens does not get in the way when shooting, and that's the most important thing. I've shot over 40 weddings and hundreds of family photo shoots with this lens, and I'm 100% happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Completely (and surprisingly) satisfied. I needed something that was not over the ...
customer_reviews.text: Completely (and surprisingly) satisfied. I needed something that was not over the top in price but comparable to the Nikkor. This is a good one. I use it on the D5000, D5100 and D5200. Each produce great images in low light. It was delivered in record time on a Wednesday and utilized on a Thursday night football game. 2.8 and 250 shutter speed produced a great image for a low light stadium. I was not on the field... I was in the stands on the 2nd row. THANKS Sigma... you've come a long way!!! 11-25-17 update. It stopped working. Will work with Amazon to see what to do next. Motor won't focus lens on subject.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Havely

customer_reviews.title: Gets great shots. Very clear images
customer_reviews.text: Gets great shots. Very clear images. F2.8 is a huge step up from my F4. My only complaint is that the auto focus switches focal points more often than other lenses I've used when taking action shots. It isn't all the time and I still get great shots but I've had a few moments missed because of it. However, the 200mm with F2.8 has also increased how many moments I was able to capture so it is a bit of a wash.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens ( Nikon version)
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great compared to Nikon 70-200 VR2 Advantage over Nikon : 1- less cost $1400 compare to $2400 2- more low hight visibility than nikon 3- better handling and gripping.. 4- Built like tank.. I drope it Two times over hard ground from 1.6 meter, nothing happen than some scratches 5- very shap ( not more than nikon) and very excellent venting ( nearly same nikon) 6- very fast facus with out any lack in low lights ( with nikon D600 and D750) High recommended,
customer_reviews.author: A. Al-Haiky

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wedding photography and this is actually one of my favorite lenses! A lot of people are surprised by this because it is bulky, but I just love the compression of the images and the close up moments you can capture with it. I pretty much keep this on the entire wedding ceremony and also use it for toasts and dances at the reception to get close ups. It is definitely heavy but so worth it for the beautiful images you can capture!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Probably the highest quality lens I own and it doesn't let me down.
customer_reviews.text: The lens doesn't change overall length with focal length....it is all handled inside. the glass is well figured, well corrected, and very high quality. The body and mechanics might not be quite as high as pro series Canon lenses but, man, does this lens deliver results at a price I can actually afford. It isn't cheap but it isn't crazy expensive either and I am happy with all of my Sigma lenses. They seem to have upped their game in the last few years from all of the research I have done prior to buying mine. No regrets here.
customer_reviews.author: MechEng

customer_reviews.title: Great lense to add to your bag
customer_reviews.text: i love this telephoto lens. Its fast and and the images are tack-sharp. My lens did not come with the mounting ring, something I can overlook since the lens I bought was used. Just something to think about if you go this route. My only complaint is the weight, this lens is heavy but the quality outweighs any negative thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great lens however....
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I’ve used it a couple sessions now and have had a great experience with it so far. Unfortunately, the lens hood they sent me doesn’t actually fit on the lens which really makes me paranoid when I’m using it. I’ve used lens hoods before but still had a friend check it out to see if I was just being an idiot and she couldn’t figure it out either even with having the same lens. Not sure what happened but was kind of disappointing there.
customer_reviews.author: Dani B.

customer_reviews.title: Great lensfor those who know how to use big glass.
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought I got a lemon but I did not realize that you don't use image stabilization when on tripod. It messes with the auto focus, [for sitll photography]. You can shoot @ 2.8 for more light but expect most of the time out of focus shot. Very small depth of field. Bump up aperture to to at least 4. Other wise great lens. Just learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect for my canon 5d mark 3
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Crystal clear photos. Sharp Images. Fast shutter speed. Lightweight. Fits perfect for my canon 5d mark 3. Cons: Makes a loud weird sound (compared to my canon 70mm and 400mm lens'). Lens hood is pretty long. Zooming speed (in & out) is a littler slower. Overall, great option for a lower costing budget that'll get pretty much similar results to $2K+ lens.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Worst 70-200 f2.8 on market
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the older model to this lens and so thought I should get this one. Images a soft, blurry most times , af is most times off so my images are rarely sharp. At 2.8 - 4 images look like it was taken with a mobile phone. Image stabilisation is a bit noisy which seems to be normal for this brand. Won't recommend anyone to purchase this lens
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K. Mayers

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for price
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a low light zoom for my camera, but they were always too expensive. I did a lot of research on this Sigma lens and saw it was just as good or better than it's rival lenses. Since getting the lens, it has not disappointed me. It is a great lens for the price, very well made and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian St. John

customer_reviews.title: Great Bokeh!
customer_reviews.text: The lens is heavy and takes some getting used to. I use a monopod or brace myself on a stationary object, but boy does it deliver! I'm a hobbyist, so I hate to spend too much money on equipment, but I've enjoyed this lens so much. I'm really, REALLY glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Laurasales saves the day.
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say thank you...thank you...thank you to Laura sales. I got my lens waaaaay earlier than I thought I would. Its was wrapped very very well. It looked practically brand new. I'm very happy with my purchase. I finally got the lens I have been wanting. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: La Tonya Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting used to this lens, but so far my it's met all my expectations. I am using a Canon EOS T2i and hope to eventually have the Canon 5D where I've heard the increase in quality will really be evident. Can't wait. But this is definitely worth the savings from the Canon lens. I researched this a lot before making my purchase and have only purchased Canon until this lens. I'm glad I did. It allowed for me to have the extra money to purchase the Canon 85mm which I also LOVE. These two lens are all any portrait photographer needs. Beginner or professional.
customer_reviews.author: Steffanie Christofore

customer_reviews.title: I still love the lens
customer_reviews.text: The seller sold me the first gen model of this lens which was disappointing. I thought I was getting the EX DD HSM Macro and did not. However, I still love the lens. It is wonderful. This is my second one. I sold my first one and missed it over a year later. Highly recommended lens.
customer_reviews.author: dinowilliams

customer_reviews.title: awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this lens. I have the Nikon version and after trying the Tamron version first, which was horrible and would not focus, I ended up buying this one and am in love with it. I can hand hold it but it is heavy so depending on the job and lighting I will use a mono pod with it. Focuses and reacts very quickly (which was the issue I had with the Tamron version). I can't imagine that the Nikon version has any better features that would be worth the extra $$ for it. If you are on the fence about it just jump ~~ you will be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Meeter

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lens. I was seriously considering the Canon, but this was less than half the price and it does a great job. I'm using this with a Canon 70D crop sensor camera so I see almost no vignetting and it focus very quick in low light. My son's baseball games don't usually start til sunset so this is a major plus. When there is an earlier game with more light it works great with my 1.4x Sigma teleconverter.
customer_reviews.author: James Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Too Soon
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the lens for 2 days, and have not had the opportunity to fully evaluate i. I'll be happy to rate the product at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: SAM ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: The autofocus is good, the construction is good
customer_reviews.text: DISCLAIMER - I bought this used on Amazon - not new. The autofocus is good, the construction is good, but I've found it to be a little soft, which is frustrating. I have other Sigma Lenses that are great, but this one seems sub par.
customer_reviews.author: Marc R. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I cannot afford an OEM 70-200 f2.8. Almost all Canon / Nikon / Sony ones comes in the $2000 + price tag. This is a great replacement for budget oriented people like me. I have experience shooting with the 70-200 f2.8 L glass from Canon. While Sigma may not be a 100% equivalent, I am sure it can do almost everything up to 95%+ accuracy like AF, OS etc, and IQ almost as good. For almost half the price, it is a great buy and great deal. Images are very sharp across the range and the Bokeh is sweet and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: JayDreamer

customer_reviews.title: I’m Loving the larger aperture Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven’t used my new lens a whole lot yet; I’m Loving the larger aperture Easy to use. Fast focus and stabilization. No problems using on cannon 3-TI. Weighs a bit more than expected. I’m expecting many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: SHEILA

customer_reviews.title: Great lens....
customer_reviews.text: I originally used this lens with my Nikon D300 but it really came into its own when used with my D800. The Sigma VR works well and allows me to shoot hand held at lower shutter speeds without having to use a tripod or monopod. The bokeh is pleasing and the lens has a fast and quiet AF. I have used it for sports, travel, and portraits. It is ruggedly built and is a good alternative to the Nikon equivalent but at a reduced price.
customer_reviews.author: Owen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the photography enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very sharp throughout the zoom range and is built very sturdy, though it is mostly plastic not metal. The focusing speed is slightly slower than my 17-55mm lens which can sometimes slow down shooting for sports/action, but this lens is significantly faster at finding focus than a 55-200mm lens so it is certainly an upgrade. If you are an amature or hobbyist and want a fast telephoto lens, go with this lens! If you make your living in photography, move up to the Nikon/Canon 70-200mm.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Teachman

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Pictures are sharp and focus is fast. Love the quiet focus as well. Great in low light. Significantly less than the Canon lens. I recently purchased the Sigma 2x teleconverter. This lens works great with it. I do not notice any loss in autofocus speed or image quality. With the Sigma 2x teleconverter this becomes a 140-400 f/5.6. Perfect pairing for when my 150-500 won't fit in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: JTCanon

customer_reviews.title: Not bad and your only bet for a HSM focus zoom ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad and your only bet for a HSM focus zoom for Pentax. Colors were a little flat, but definitely a sharp lens, even wide open. Shoot RAW and increase saturation and contrast in post processing. Unfortunately, I ended up returning it as I sold all my Pentax gear and made the switch to Canon. There is no match for the Canon 70-200mm L 2.8 USM for those of us who need a zoom like this for sports.
customer_reviews.author: Keith in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Nice, for the money...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up selling mine because I decided to buy the Canon 70-200 2.8 IS. Although Canon's is better, it's certainly not TWICE as good. If you can find a good used one, save a few hundred dollars, that's the way to go. One of the things I liked most was the tripod mount--very innovative design, better than Canon's. If you're not a professional, get this lens and you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: AllThingsTech

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Takes clear more distant photos, excellent condition. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Mccray

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. Works well with my Nikon D7100. ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Works well with my Nikon D7100. A little pricey but this is lower than most.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: sigma costs less, performs the same
customer_reviews.text: in my professional opinion...the Sigma 70-200mm f2.8 APO EX DG HSM OS FLD telephoto lens is a fantastic performing lens...It's very sharp on both my 5D Mark III & 7D...bokeh is creamy & very pleasing...the focusing seems to be as quick if not a little faster than the Canon version 1 lens...the OS performs great & focusing is silent only complaints i have are: no weather sealing (at least sigma does not say so) & the zoom ring is toward the end of the lens, making it awkward compared to Canon lenses
customer_reviews.author: Grease Man Photography

customer_reviews.title: Turns out to be a great lens
customer_reviews.text: NOVEMBER, 2012: Having used the lens even more extensively lately, I have revised my rating to five stars. When I first got it, I had trouble keeping a solid connection to my D4. However, I have since removed the lens and refastened it several times, and I am very pleased to say that it's working wonderfully now. I use it primarily for sports: football, basketball and volleyball so far. It's done a consistently excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Danton M.

customer_reviews.title: Sigma lens is outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. Tack sharp at all focal lengths. We have a photography business and this is a must have for weddings. Especially the ceremony.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Schroppe

customer_reviews.title: Autofocus stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lens in September 2018 and the auto focus just quit working. When focusing you can just hear the motor trying to move but it will not. Given how much I spent on this lens this is incredibly disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Gillette26

customer_reviews.title: Look no further...BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a stellar lens...bottom line. Paired with my Nikon D800, it is a match made is resolution heaven. Sharpness is unmatched through the entire focal range, and the optical stabilization is phenomenal. I previously used the Nikon 70-200 f4, which pales in comparison. For the price, this Sigma is a stunning piece of professional glass.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I find any excuse to get out and use it. I have it on my T6i and I rarely take it off when I’m outdoors. I’m so happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Walton

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: Although my heart wanted the new Nikon 2.8 70-200, I thought of all the other camera equipment I could buy with the difference. I am not disappointed, the shots I have taken are quite impressive - perhaps, I don't know what I am missing since I have not done side by side comparison with the Nikon. With the Sigma, I am able to get crystal clear shots of my kids doing their sports - running and swimming. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: A Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Condition was as posted like new, although the listing showed a case with ...
customer_reviews.text: Condition was as posted like new, although the listing showed a case with it and when it arrived it didn't have the case, but for the price was good and I can always go out and buy a case. Plenty out there. The lens works great on my a99ii and the a55.
customer_reviews.author: David Robb

customer_reviews.title: This lens ROCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: Ahhh.. the difference on this upgrade. I can't say enough about it. I'm a professional photographer and this lens more than meets my expectations. Crisp, sharp and overall Awesome!!! Definitely worth the money spent at a fraction of the cost of Nikon's version. 100 % satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: D. Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Considerable Blur at 200mm, f/2.8 - Returned Lens
customer_reviews.text: This Sigma was way out of focus at 200mm f/2.8 and the optical stabilization seemed to make no difference. I immediately returned this and ordered the Nikon 70-200 f/2.8 VR lens. I took the exact same test shots with both cameras at 200 mm zoom and a wide open aperture of f/2.8. The Nikon shots were clear and crisp whereas the Sigma shots had significant blur. You can see the difference in the attached photos. The blur with the Sigma was the same with No OS, OS1 and OS2 (it has two optical stabilization settings) and it was the same even with the camera mounted on a tripod. Needless to say, I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Papatone

customer_reviews.title: It'll be 5 stars if it wasn't for the problems with the Autofocus which seems to be a frequent problem
customer_reviews.text: It's an amazing lens, however, I had a problem with the AutoFocus (which has been mentioned in several forums over the Internet) and it happened to me as well. I send it back to Sigma and they fixed it. I had to incur in additional charges which doesn't make me very happy. Once again, as far as the lens go, it has an amazing range and the luminosity is what you'd expect on a lens that range and that size.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! It is my chosen workhorse for wedding photography. The reason for 4/5 is the focus took some time to adjust so it wasn’t so soft in focusing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Solid Lens
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Canon 70D. Only issue I've seen is the lock to the camera body isn't as tight as with my other lenses. Might just be due to the heft of this lens.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pedley

customer_reviews.title: Great lens. I am so excited
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I am so excited. I have been wanting this lens for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lindie

customer_reviews.title: As a professional photographer I have got to say that this lens is amazing! Beautifully sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to lens! As a professional photographer I have got to say that this lens is amazing! Beautifully sharp, great bokeh, and well built. I highly recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N.

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens! I'm not a professional and that's the only reason I chose not to go with the Canon. With that said, I am very pleased with my choice. If you are debating between this lens and the Canon f2.8 and you are not a pro shooter then get this lens! You will not be disappointed and you can use the extra $1000 to but another lens, awsome lights, or whatever else you need for your bag. Don't break the bank if the lens isn't going to put money back into it!
customer_reviews.author: dfoster700

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, never saw myself buying a lens that cost this much, it was purchased at a good price considering what I would have to pay for the same Sony version. I purchased this lens for my Sony A99 and I haven't been disappointed with it yet, Super quite when shooting weddings and doing event photography it also has outstanding low light picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: NOBS

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over previous model
customer_reviews.text: I bought the previous incarnation of the Sigma 70-200 f2.8 about 4 years ago, and was happy with the results. It was sharp, virtually silent, and focused quickly. It didn't have OS (aka VR), which really makes a difference with a lens this long and heavy. Actually, OS is all I expected to gain from this upgrade, so I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was a major improvement in almost every way. It is sharper, focuses better in low light, has better bokeh, and the OS is worth about 3 stops. The result of all this is noticably better looking photos, and a higher percent of keepers from every shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Lyonardo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens for hockey photography!
customer_reviews.text: Fast, quality lens. Using it on my new Nikon camera - great for low light, indoor action sports photography. Have compared this to the Nikon lens and there is not much difference. For the price, this is the best value out there.
customer_reviews.author: JulieC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Sooo happy I bought this!! Great lens! Sharp, fast, almost non-existent CA, and solidly built. Coming from a cheapy Canon 75-300 4-5.6, this is a dream. The image stabilizer works great for me, and the lower light capabilities rock. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful so Far!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Sigma 70-200 after many reading many reviews, and trying to decide between buying Sigma and Canon. I am happy to say that even though the focus is slightly slower than I was expecting, that the lense performs beautifully. Very Happy with the purchase, all though I MAY stick to the Canon line more often than not.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: This zoom is a great addition to my camera bag. Just used it to shoot a concert in Vegas. Got some awesome shots of people and performers. The focus is kind of funny how it bounces, but it functions!
customer_reviews.author: Danimal43

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. don't love the size though. but i'm really happy with it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Q.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: An EXCELLENT lens for portraits, events, and wildlife shooting! Its speed allows for great shooting in lower light conditions. I highly recommend it ... and am considering the 2x attachment for it as well!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Bell

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret your purchase!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses! Beautiful images on my Nikon D3100 and my D500.
customer_reviews.author: N. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Up to Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Really like this lens. I purchased to use for photos of semi-pro football games, many at night, and performance has been just what I hoped for. Quick focusing, even on poorly lit fields, super fast focusing during the daytime, and works well with my Sigma 1.4TC.
customer_reviews.author: Rats56

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super sharp lens and is great for photographs of basketball in a gym or out on the soccer field. It also takes great portraits with excellent bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! great clarity
customer_reviews.text: Took this lens out last night for the first time since receiving it. Love it! great clarity, fast focus, and it is really made very well. It IS heavy but worth the weight for the pictures it produces. :)
customer_reviews.author: C. Behrends

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I shoot my kids sports (hockey and dance competitions) and I can't be happier with the results. I looked at the Sigma, Tamron and Nikon versions. I finally decided to take the plunge with the Sigma and I don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve, Camarillo, CA.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens & can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. I think it's as good if not better than the Nikon version and at about half the price how could you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of the Nikkor, Heavy to carry around
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of the Nikkor. Image meets my expectation. It is tiring to carry this thing for 6+ hours because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lens.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. I think it is better than the Tamron 70-200mm f/2.8
customer_reviews.author: Ken Parks

customer_reviews.title: Not E mount
customer_reviews.text: The ad did not disclose if this was an A mount or E mount. It is an A mount.I am trying a A to E converter, hope it doesn't cause problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this. I waited so long to buy a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I waited so long to buy a 70-200 and after renting a few over the summer I settled on this one and I couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This was an investment and its just a little heavy for my to use more often. However it works great with my Nikon D5100. Its a little loud as everyone knows but for the price its a steal.
customer_reviews.author: cary polston

customer_reviews.title: Sigma glass ROCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This lense is fast and accurate. I shoot professionally and I was reluctant to purchase non-canon glass but this lense has sharp detail, great speed and fantastic low light abilities for half the price. Build construction is solid and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Emmack

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 70-200 f-2.8 Review.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens for money. Fast, accurate focusing, great image quality. Nikon's counterpart not anywhere near a $1000.00 better lens. I have the Sigma 17-70, and will eventually get either their 120-400 or their 150-500 as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: My most trusted lens. The clarity and bokeh is ...
customer_reviews.text: My most trusted lens. The clarity and bokeh is very sharp and creamy smooth. I've shot some decent images and still learning every day with it.
customer_reviews.author: TheFourthWall

customer_reviews.title: I can't see how the Canon version could be better by any significant amount
customer_reviews.text: I can't see how the Canon version could be better by any significant amount. This lens is sharp, has great color, and is great in lower light situations. At $1000.00 less, this thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: jody e terrell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the price. This is my favorite lens, to date. I have not had any issues from it whatsoever. It focuses fast enough, it's sharp enough, and I don't see too much CA. To be fair, I have never used the name brand lens that is $2-3,000 more. But, I don't think I'll need to, either.
customer_reviews.author: Sariandan

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC LENS!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW...I was extremely impressed with most of the photos I made with this lens. The optical stabilization is FANTASTIC! Hand held all the way out was no problem. On the down side, It was not really razor sharp at 2.8, but few lenses are ever super sharp wide open. The auto focus on my copy was inaccurate most of the time and attempts to manually fine tune were overridden by the auto focus mechanism while in auto mode. I ultimately sent it back because on my APSC sensor camera the focal length was the equivalent of 112-320 and that is much too long at the wide end for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my wife’s Christmas present. Today 3/3/18 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife’s Christmas present. Today 3/3/18 is her first day to really use it and after a few practice shots the focus froze and now it won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: jeff brines

customer_reviews.title: Sigma 70-200 f/2.8 APO EX HSM OS FLD
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this lens. I bought it as a cheaper alternative to the Canon equivalent and I'm not disappointed. I use it on my 5D and 5D Mark II and it gives crisp results, although with aperture wide open there is some vignetting. I did try the camera out on my 7D (crop sensor) and had issues with focusing, but I've moved completely to full frame so this does not affect me. As for the lens construction, it's solid! Don't be afraid to buy this lens if the Canon is out of your budget!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

product_meta.title: Sigma 70-200mm f/2.8 APO EX DG HSM OS FLD Large Aperture Telephoto Zoom Lens for Sony Digital DSLR Camera
product_meta.description:
Style:Sony Digital DSLR CameraFROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

LARGE APERTURE TELEPHOTO ZOOM LENS INCORPORATING SIGMA'S ORIGINAL OPTICAL STABILIZER FUNCTION
This large aperture telephoto zoom lens, incorporating Sigma's original Optical Stabilizer function, covers focal lengths from 70mm to 200mm and offers a constant aperture of F2.8 over the entire zoom range. The OS function offers the use of shutter speeds approximately 4 stops slower than would otherwise be possible. It makes shooting easy for many types of photography such as portraits and sports. Two FLD ("F" Low Dispersion) glass elements, which have performance equal to fluorite glass, and three SLD (Special Low Dispersion) glass elements provide excellent correction of color aberration. Super Multi-Layer Coating reduces flare and ghosting. The lens incorporates HSM (Hyper Sonic Motor), ensuring a quiet and high speed AF as well as full-time manual focus capability. It is also possible to attach Sigma's optional APO Tele Converters.

No Optical Stabilizer (top). With Optical Stabilizer (bottom). SUPER MULTI-LAYER COATING
The lens is equipped with Sigma's own unique OS (Optical Stabilizer) function. This system offers the use of shutter speeds approximately 4 stops slower than would otherwise be possible, making telephoto shooting easy. Mode 1 is ideal for general photography and Mode 2 is designed for panning subjects such as racing cars. For Sony and Pentax mount, the built-in OS function of this lens can be used even if the camera body is equipped with an anti-shake function. As compensation for camera shake is visible in the view finder, the photographer can easily check for accurate focus and ensure there is no subject movement.

* For Pentax and Sony mounts, it is not possible to use the AF and the built-in OS function of this lens when attaching it to film SLR cameras as well as Pentax ist series and K100D.

* When using the OS function of a lens with a camera which incorporates a stabilizer unit, please turn the camera's stabilizer unit off.

* This lens cannot be used with film SLR cameras with the exception of the Nikon F6 and Canon EOS-1v.

COMPACT CONSTRUCTION
This lens has a compact construction with a diameter of 3.4in, overall length of 7.8in. and weight of 50.4oz. This compact and lightweight construction makes it ideal for many types of photography such as portraits, landscapes and sports.

No Super Multi-Layer Coating (left). With Super Multi-Layer Coating (right). EXCELLENT OPTICAL PERFORMANCE
This lens features two FLD ("F" Low Dispersion) glass elements, which have the performance equal to fluorite glass, and three SLD (Special Low Dispersion) glass elements providing excellent correction of color aberration. The Super Multi-Layer Coating reduces flare and ghosting and ensures high contrast images. High image quality is assured throughout the entire zoom range.

* FLD glass is the highest level low dispersion glass available with extremely high light transmission. This optical glass has a performance equal to fluorite glass which has a low refractive index and low dispersion compared to current optical glass. It also benefits from high anomalous dispersion.

These characteristics give excellent correction for residual chromatic aberration (secondary spectrum) which cannot be corrected by ordinary optical glass and ensures high definition and high contrast images.

Hyper Sonic Motor HIGH SPEED AND QUIET AF
HSM indicates lenses equipped with a Hyper Sonic Motor, driven by ultrasonic waves. Incorporation of HSM (Hyper Sonic Motor) ensures quiet and high speed autofocus, while allowing full-time manual focus override.

* For Sony and Pentax mount, AF will not function with DSLR cameras that do not support HSM.

ROUNDED DIAPHRAGM
This lens has a rounded 9 blade diaphragm which creates an attractive bokeh to the out of focus area.

LENS CONSTRUCTION
In a conventional lens, focusing requires an extension of the entire lens or the front lens group. However, to better accommodate autofocusing mechanisms and closeup photography, a need has arisen for lenses that do not change their length during focusing or suffer from focus-dependent variation in aberration. Therefore, Sigma has developed focusing systems that only move elements within the lens barrel. These incorporate smaller and lighter moving lens elements which help improve auto-focus speed. With their unchanging barrel length and small variation in the center of gravity, these lenses also enhance balance and stability for the photographer. Furthermore, since the front of the lens does not rotate, polarizing filters can be used with extra convenience.

SPECIFICATIONS
Lens Construction 22 Elements in 17 Groups Angle of View 34.3 - 12.3 degrees Number of Diaphragm Blades 9 Blades (Rounded diaphragm) Minimum Aperture F22 Minimum Focusing Distance 140cm / 55.1in. Maximum Magnification 1:8 Dimensions Diameter 86.4mm x Length 197.6mm /3.4in. x 7.8in. Weight 1430g / 50.4oz. MTF CHART
View Larger Image MTF (Modular Transfer Function) is one of the measurements that evaluates a lens' performance, and it contrasts sensitivity at different spacial frequencies. The horizontal axis is in millimeters and shows the distance from the center of the image toward the edges, and contrast value (highest value is 1) is shown in the vertical axis.

The readings at 10 lines per millimeter measure the lens' contrast ability (red lines), repeating fine parallel lines spaced at 30 lines per millimeter measure the lens' sharpness ability (green lines), when the aperture is wide open. Fine repeating line sets are created parallel to a diagonal line running from corner to corner of the frame, are called Sagittal lines (S) and sets of repeating lines vertical to these lines are drawn, called Meridional (M) line sets.

DISTORTION
View Larger Image effective distortion: When you take a picture of a lattice pattern, it will appear as the blue dotted line shows. the red line illustrates how the lattice pattern will appear in the actual picture when any lens distortion is taken into account.

relative distortion: In this chart, the horizontal axis shows the ideal image height (the distance from the center to the edge of the image [mm]). The vertical axis shows the extent of distortion. The extent of the distortion is represented by how much Y, which is the actual image height, grows (or shrinks) against Y0 which is the ideal image height.

Extent of distortion: D[%]=(Y-Y0/Y0)x100

When you take the picture of a square object, if the distortion amount show a minus value, the image will be seen as expanded (Barrel distortion). If the distortion amount is a plus value, it will be seen as a recessed (pincushi on distortion). When the distortion value is close to 0, the appearance of distortion is very minimal.

VIGNETTING
View Larger Image The horizontal axis shows the image height (the distance from the center to the edge of the image [mm]). The vertical axis shows the amount of light in the image (based on the amount of light in the image center being 100%). If the peripheral amount of light is lower than the center, the four corners of the image will be darker (vignetting).
feature_bullets: 105-300mm equivalent focal length on APS-C cameras, 112-320mm equivalent focal length on Canon APS-C cameras
F2.8 constant maximum aperture; F22 minimum
Ring-type ultrasonic-type AF motor with full-time manual focusing
Image stabilization, 4 stops claimed. Dual mode, normal and panning
Available in Canon EF, Nikon F (FX), Pentax KAF3, Sony Alpha, Sigma SA mounts
